main_definition: To examine, assess or re-evaluate something with the purpose of gaining a better understanding or preparing for future use.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Assessing someone's work or performance after completion
meanings_and_examples.example: The professor will review my essay before giving me feedback.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Revisiting old memories, experiences or events
meanings_and_examples.example: Every summer, we take the time to review our high school days and reminisce about past times.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Examining something again in order to make changes or improvements
meanings_and_examples.example: The company is currently reviewing its policies to address recent customer complaints.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reviewing documents, such as legal papers or contracts before finalizing them
meanings_and_examples.example: Before signing the lease agreement, both parties took the time to thoroughly review the terms and conditions.
